functions package¶

Submodules¶

functions.load_data module¶

functions.load_data.interpolate_nan(data)¶

Interpolates NaN values in the the ECG

Data passed in may contain NaN values where there were strings or blank spaces in the data, causing gaps in the data. This script interpolates over those gaps.

Parameters:data (np array) – a numpy array containing time, first col, and ECG, second col, signals. May contain NaN values.
Returns:numpy array with interpolated NaN values
Return type:1D numpy array
functions.load_data.nan_inds(x)¶

Function to handle indices and logical indices of NaNs.

Args
x (1D numpy array): a vector (time or ECG) containing NaN values
Returns:array where True denotes a NaN value function: a function which return on all non-zero values, used to index the interpolation
Return type:1D numpy array, bool
functions.load_data.non_zero_func(x)¶

Function which returns non-zero indices of an array

Parameters:x (1d numpy array) – input array
Returns:output non-zero indicies
Return type:1d numpy array
functions.load_data.read_csv(filename)¶

Reads in an input CSV file

This function takes a filename and reads in a file and outputs its contents. The file should be in csv format and have 2 columns representing time and voltage measurements.

Parameters:filename (str) – path to a csv file containing ECG data
Returns:numpy array containing two columns, time and ECG voltage
Return type:numpy array
functions.load_data.verify_csv_extension(file)¶

Verifies that the extension of the file passed to read_csv denotes a csv file

Parameters:string (str) – path to input file
Returns:returns if the input file is a .csv file
Return type:bool

functions.process_ecg module¶

functions.process_ecg.calc_duration(data, metrics)¶

Calculate the duration of the ECG strip

Parameters:
  • data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data
  • metrics (dict) – dictionary containing ECG metrics
Returns:

dictionary with ‘duration’ field containing an float

in seconds
Return type:

dict
functions.process_ecg.filter_ecg(data)¶

Filter the input ECG using a bandpass

Sequential high and low-pass filters create a bandpass effect. The resulting signal will be centered on zero (resting potential).

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data
Returns:modified array with now-filtered ECG data
Return type:2D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.high_pass_filter(volts, kernel_size=401)¶

High pass filtered the ECG signal

Median filtration will preserve the signal mean around the resting signal.

Parameters:
  • volts (1D numpy array) – voltage measurements of ECG
  • kernel_size (int) – size of the median filter
Returns:

low pass filtered ECG signal
Return type:

1D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.invert_ecg(volt)¶

This function inverts the ECG if the more prominent peaks are negative.

Parameters:volt (1D numpy array) – an array containing filtered ECG measurements
Returns:
an array which contains voltages which have been
flipped upside down if they have greater negative values.
Return type:1D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.load_rpeak()¶

Loads a sample R-peak for beat detection

Returns:sample waveform, normalized to 1
Return type:floats, 1D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.low_pass_filter(volts, sigma=2, kernel_size=7)¶

Low pass filter function to filter ECG

Parameters:
  • volts (1D numpy array) – voltage measurements of ECG
  • sigma (int) – parameter describing the frequency of the filter
  • kernel_size (int) – size of the Gaussian kernel
Returns:

low pass filtered ECG signal
Return type:

1D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.nonmax_supression(x)¶

Nonmaximum suppression finds crests of a signal. All other non-maxima found from thresholding are suppressed.

Parameters:x (1D numpy array) – a signal which has been thresholded to only contain maximum peaks.
Returns:an array indexes for local maxima
Return type:1D numpy array
functions.process_ecg.normalize_ecg(data)¶

This function normalizes the ECG signal.

This function scales the signal into a standard range, with R-peaks being brought near 1.

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – contains two columns with time and ECG data

Returns:

functions.process_ecg.r_peak_detection(data)¶

Detection of R-peaks in an ECG signal

This function loads a sample QRS complex and computes a corrlation on an input ECG signal. Areas of high correction are found via thresholding and nonmaximum suppression is used to detect maxima (R-peak locations).

Parameters:data (2D numpy array) – array with two columns columns containing time and ECG data
Returns:return the index locations of detected R-peaks.
Return type:1D numpy array

functions.write_results module¶

functions.write_results.gen_outpath(save_path)¶

Determines the existence of a folder and creates if if needed.

Parameters:save_path (str) – relative path to a folder in which to save the output.
Returns:value indicating if the output folder was successfully created.
Return type:bool
functions.write_results.gen_save_filename(filename, save_path)¶

Generates the filename in which to save the results.

The filename will be the same as the input filename. The data will be saved as a JSON file and placed in a directory within root called “output_data”.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – path to the input csv file as given by the user.
  • save_path (str) – base path in which to save output files
Returns:

new filename of a JSON file to be used to save the calculated

metrics.
Return type:

str
functions.write_results.print_metrics(metrics, filename)¶

This function simply prints the calculated metrics to the terminal.

This function is useful for immediate debugging as it shows the calculated metrics directly in the terminal window.

Parameters:metrics (dict) – dictionary of calculated ECG metrics.

Returns:

functions.write_results.write_json(metrics, filename)¶

Function writes metrics to a JSON file.

Parameters:
  • metrics (dict) – dictionary containing calculated metrics for the ECG.
  • filename (str) – filename, including path, of the JSON file to be written.

Returns:

functions.write_results.write_results_to_file(metrics, filename)¶

Writes the calculated metrics in a JSON file.

This function takes the metrics and filename of the input csv file. It generates an output folder and makes a new file in that folder named after the input csv file. The metrics calculated in the previous parts of the code are written to this file.

Parameters:
  • (dict (metrics) – a dictionary containing all of the metrics calculated by this program on the ECG.
  • filename (str) – name of the input csv file.

Returns:
